title: Michael Zargari
text:
My name is Michael Zargari. I am a Master of Environmental Data Science (MEDS) student at the Bren School of Environmental Science & Management at the University of California-Santa Barbara (UCSB). I graduated from UCSB in 2022 with a B.S. in Statistics and Data Science, B.A. in Economics, and minors in Iranian Studies and Translation Studies. I started my academic career in 2018 as a Judith Stapelmann Scholar and was awarded the Jeremy D. Friedman Memorial Award in June 2022.
Coming from a unique background, I have a wide range of experience completing internships at globally recognized companies AIG and Lyft and participating in research at UCSB where I have completed work as a data analyst, data scientist, statistical researcher, underwriter, and actuary.
My goal is to continue these efforts to influence climate policy at the corporate, national, and state levels.




Master of Environmental Data Science (Expected June 2023)  Bren School of Environmental Science & Management  University of California, Santa Barbara
B.S. Statistics and Data Science, Honors Distinction, 3.69 GPA (June 2022)  Bachelor of Arts in Economics, Honors Distinction, 3.69 GPA (June 2022)  Minor in Translation Studies | Minor in Iranian Studies  University of California, Santa Barbara




Underwriting Intern – American International Group (AIG), San Francisco, CA (6/22–7/22)  Assistant Manager – University Center Hub, Santa Barbara, CA (8/21–present)  Student Caucus Chair – Student Health Insurance Plan Advisory Committee, Hybrid (9/19–present)  Chair of External Affairs – Student Fee Advisory Committee, Santa Barbara, CA (9/19–6/22)  Executive Co-Chair and Founder – Promise Scholar Advisory Board, Santa Barbara, CA (1/19–6/22)
